page.title: 17COUNTRY HOUSES
page.content: Brayton was the estate of the wealthy Lawson family. Earliest records date back to 1749. The most famous Lawson was Sir Wilfred who was a Member of Parliament, an author and a local philanthropist. The original house was burnt down in 1929 and was never restored. During the war the estate was taken over as a base for the R.A.F.. The Lawson family died out and the land now belongs to the Ward family, who live in the original gardener's cottage. Most of the 300 acres are let out for grazing, but the garden area has been turned into a golf course and driving range for public use. The Hall fish pond is open to the public at Â£3 per day. Carp is the main fish caught. The Ward family hope to extend their facilities in the near future.
